relationships.notes: Their presence in Nazareth anchors perceptions of Jesus’s ordinary family roots, which fuel hometown skepticism about his authority.
Mentioned alongside Mary and the brothers, indicating that the wider sibling group belongs to the same Nazareth household that shaped Jesus’s upbringing.

traits.mention_in_hometown_scene: Referred to collectively when the people of Nazareth identify Jesus by his family, noting that his sisters are present among them.
traits.implied_presence: Their mention suggests an extended family network in Nazareth but provides no individual names or stories.
traits.function_in_narrative: Contributes to the portrayal of Jesus as someone known in ordinary family terms whose claims and deeds provoke offense in his hometown.
